discussion.content: I dont trust the answers anymore, 1-236 there was a similar question where the answer was production of one ore more..

choices.B: The addition of an improvement to a product description
choices.C: A prototype demonstrating a possible design solution
choices.A: An interdependency between products that was previously unidentified
choices.D: The production of more than the defined quantity of a specialist product

questions.question_text: Which is a minimum requirement for applying the quality theme?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. A record must be kept of all the quality management activities that are planned.

This ensures that there is a documented approach to managing quality throughout the project, which is essential for accountability, traceability, and demonstrating that quality requirements are being met. While the other options (A, C, and D) are good practices, they are not the minimum requirement for applying the quality theme.

A. Appraisal methods of quality control must be carried out on products.

Here's why this is essential:

Quality Control is Fundamental: The Quality theme in PRINCE2 is all about making sure the project delivers products (outputs) that meet the required standards and are fit for their intended purpose. This means you must have ways to check the quality of those products.
Appraisal Methods: Appraisal methods are those quality control checks. They could be:
Inspections: Physically checking the product.
Reviews: Examining documents or designs.
Testing: Trying out the product to see if it works as expected.
Demonstrations: Showing how the product functions.

B, I beleieve. Quality Theme Objective: "Maintan records to provide evidience that the planned quality activities have been carried out, and summarise those activities that are planned or have taken place in some form of Quality Register"

choices.A: Appraisal methods of quality control must be carried out on products
choices.B: A record must be kept of all the quality management activities that are planned
choices.C: The quality review technique must be used when reviewing products
choices.D: The quality management approach must align with corporate standards

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct, take corrective action

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
The purpose of the Controlling a Stage process (CS) is for the Project Manager to assign the work to be done, monitor this work, deal with issues, report Progress to the Project Board and take corrective action to ensure that the stage remains within tolerance.
B is correct: take corrective action

choices.B: Select and implement actions that will resolve deviations from a plan within tolerance
choices.D: Update a Project Plan to incorporate the actuals from a Stage Plan
choices.C: Obtain approvals for products delivered in a Work Package
choices.A: Produce a Team Plan for the work to be assigned to a Team Manager

questions.question_text: Who represents the three project interests on a project?
Which PRINCE2 principle helps to address a concern that the project team may NOT have worked on a similar project?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The PRINCE2 principle that helps to address the concern that the project team may not have worked on a similar project is:

B. Learn from experience.

This principle emphasizes the importance of learning from past projects, both successes and failures, to improve current and future project performance. If the team lacks experience with similar projects, they can seek lessons from other projects, industry best practices, or external sources to guide their approach and decision-making. This helps mitigate risks and increases the likelihood of project success.

Selected Answer: B
Principle 2: Learn from experience
PRINCE2 encourages project managers to continuously learn throughout the project, building upon experiences from each stage and previously delivered projects. The teams need to establish a system that captures these experiences and documents them for future referencing, maximising the benefits of both positive and negative experiences.

These answers are all wrong, first principle; 
Ensure continued business justification
A PRINCE2 project has business justification sufficient to warrant investment to initiate the project
and ongoing investment through to successful completion. If it does not, it should be stopped.

Selected Answer: B
Learn from Experience

Selected Answer: A
I would argue that this is not about lessons learned but about the names and structures. Hence it is A. But I did not check the book yet.
